prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia District Pilot International records, 1947-2003. Accession 36420. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bobbie B. Hudson of Danville, Virginia, and Carolyn Cattle of Marion, Virginia.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Accessions 38675 and 43133 are interfiled with Accession 36420.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Pilot Internation was chartered as a service organization in Macon, Georgia, in 1921. The Virginia District began in 1937, when the first Pilot club in Virginia was established in Bristol. Currently, the Virginia District consists of thirteen clubs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1947-2003, of Virginia District Pilot International consisting of correspondence, directories, financial records, handbooks, histories, manuals, minutes, newsletters, notes, reports, rosters, surveys, and other papers which document and detail the history, organization, and goals of the Virginia District Pilot International.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series III: Conventions and Fall Councils, 1973-1997.
Series V: Handicapped/Disabled Professional Woman/Person of the Year, 1978-1995.
Series VIII: General Files and Ephemera.

scopecontent.p: Administrative Records, 1972-2000, contain articles of incorporation, budgets, correspondence, financial papers, goals, handbooks, manuals, minutes, nominations, notes, reports, rosters, standing rules, surveys, and other papers concerning the administrative operations of the Virginia District Internation Pilot organization and its youth branch of Anchor Clubs.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1: Articles of Incorporation, guidelines, and handbooks.
Subseries 3: District Secretary's Minutes and Notes, 1994-2000.

scopecontent.p: Meeting Minutes, 1974-1995, contains minutes and other papers recording the meetings of the District Administrative Council (DAC) and the Board of Directors of the Virginia District Pilot International.

did.unittitle: Series III: Conventions and Fall Councils, 1973-1997.

scopecontent.p: Conventions and Fall Councils, 1973-1997, contain agendas, budgets, correspondence, fliers, minutes, notes, programs, reports, speeches, surveys, and other papers detailing district conventions and fall councils, as well as some Pilot International national conventions.
Governor's Bulletins, 1988-1996, consist of the Governor's Bulletin newsletter containing news of the district, the district clubs, and the national organization, as well as related papers.

did.unittitle: Series V: Handicapped/Disabled Professional Woman/Person of the Year, 1978-1995.

scopecontent.p: Handicapped/Disabled Professional Woman/Person of the Year, 1978-1995, contains biographies, correspondence, nomination forms, photographs, and other papers regarding the Virginia District award to disabled individuals. Candidates were nominated by individual clubs.

did.unittitle: Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1978 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1979 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1980 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1981 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1982 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1983 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1984 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1985 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1986 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1987 .
Handicapped Professional Woman of the Year, 1988 .
Disabled Professional Woman of the Year, 1989 .
Disabled Professional Woman of the Year, 1990 .
Disabled Professional Woman of the Year, 1991 .
Disabled Professional Woman of the Year, 1992 .
Disabled Professional Person of the Year, 1993 .
Disabled Professional Person of the Year, 1994 .
Disabled Professional Person of the Year, 1995 .
Disabled Professional Person of the Year related papers.

scopecontent.p: Local Clubs, 1947, 1968-2003, contain agendas, awards, badges, clippings, correspondence, financial records, forms, handbooks, histories, minutes, newsletters, photographs, plaques, reports, rosters, speeches, yearbooks, and related papers concerning the organization and activities of the local clubs in the Virginia District Pilot International and their relation to the Virginia District.

did.unittitle: Marion: minutes and treasurer's reports, June 1991-September 1995 (folder 1 of 2).
Marion: minutes and treasurer's reports, June 1991-September 1995 (folder 2 of 2).
Suffolk: yearbook and roster, 1996-1997[?], no date .

scopecontent.p: Pilot International Papers, 1989-1998, consist of articles of incorporation, by-laws, correspondence, directories, financial records, manuals, magazines, minutes, programs, reports, and other papers concerning the national organization and its foundation, the Pilot International Foundation, as well as Pilot International's relation with the Virginia District.

did.unittitle: By-laws and amendments (including the Pilot International Foundation).
Kentucky-Ohio-West Virginia District Fall Council, 1993 (3 copies).
Series VIII: General Files and Ephemera.

scopecontent.p: General Files and Ephemera contain papers concerning a reading program, brain injuries, and emergency response programs; certificates; patterns; stickers; and miscellaneous papers. Ephemera include Robert's Rules of Order, a brief-case, a 3-hole punch, and rubber stamps.

did.unittitle: Briefcase labeled Governor, District 11 Pilot International.
Rubber stamps, 2 labelled BANQUET, 2 labelled BREAKFAST, 1 labelled LUNCHEON, and 1 labelled LUNCH.
Award from Big Brothers/Big Sisters to the Pilot Club of Marion (see box 18 folder 1).
Charter of the Pilot Club of Marion (original--see box 15 folder 7), 28 February 1947 .
